meanings.definition: A person who has confidence in the truth or existence of something.
meanings.sent1: The believers in aliens were excited about the UFO sighting.
meanings.sent2: The group of believers gathered at the church every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The believers in magic were disappointed when the rabbit disappeared for real.
meanings.sent4: She was a true believer in the power of positive thinking.
meanings.sent5: The believers in ghosts claimed to have seen a spirit in the old house.

meanings.definition: Those who accept something as true or real.
meanings.sent1: The believers in the Loch Ness Monster were eager to find evidence.
meanings.sent2: The believers in climate change advocate for environmental protection.
meanings.sent3: The believers in Santa Claus were shocked when they saw him at the mall.
meanings.sent4: He was a firm believer in the importance of education for all.
meanings.sent5: The believers in luck always carried their lucky charms with them.
